intro: Perilepta amplectens, commonly known as the clustered leaf sponge. It is a species of sponge that belongs to the family Dendrophylliidae. This sponge is characterized by its dense, clustered growth pattern and its ability to form symbiotic relationships with certain algae. The structure of Perilepta amplectens includes a calcareous skeleton that provides support and protection. It is typically found in shallow tropical waters, where it thrives in warm, clear conditions.
